references.formattedCitation: Arthur, Paul, and Filippo Coarelli, eds. Minturnae. Roma: NER, 1989. http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/21672619.
Wikipedia: L’enciclopedia libera e collaborativa. Wikimedia Foundation, 2001. https://it.wikipedia.org.

description: Originally an Ausonian town that fought against Rome in 314 B.C., Minturnae became a colony in 296 B.C. The site is located on the Garigliano river (ancient Liris) and served an important economic function. The Via Appia passes through the city.
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: near Minturno
